intro: Hancea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy hancea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Hancea hirsuta is typically found in moist, tropical environments and is often used in traditional medicine.
